column4: Niekie: ah right - so am i best of switching back to windows until i get a nVidia card or should i plough on?
Niekie: Output: direct rendering: Yes
Niekie: heh - Always a start i guess =)
in fact i think up to x1900 type cards are supported
Niekie: I have all the funky effects working - i just have a lousy resolution of 1024 x 768 - i just want to up it to 1280 x 1024 at least
Niekie: http://paste.biz/paste-2360.html
A Dialup modem or a ADSL One? 0.o
- heh Modems - never thought i would hear that word again
- Sometimes i wish linux was a little more - Adaptable to hardware =(
- i have tried most distros - feddora, black box, open suse, sled, etc
- but in my opinion - Ubuntu has the better user base!! Mush more friendlier and more helpful
Whats up with firefox? I used opera in the past but prefered Firefox tbh

nothing against firefox, but opera is damn powerfull damn fast and you don't have to download a gangload of extentions to do what opera does out of the box, of course it's better for those just wana leave ie and have more security and much better features
True - it used to be a little bloated last time i used it (a few years back) is it worth giving it another whirl?
- might give it another shot then - got any other cool apps i should try out?
you might wana get wine, allows you to run windows apps in linux,be aware it has it's limits, then you want to get firestarer (firewall)
Yeah i tried Wine when i used to be on Fedora- but it broke and i have had nightmares ever since =(
Awesome - i will give that another try too. Im just about to embark on installing MySQL!
phew is all i can say, never ever touched it, worried about hard that's going to be, currently reading two ubuntu books and have many little notes docs about ubuntu
I just fired up a guide on google and giving it a shot - what books have you got? Are they any good?

well i got the oficial ubuntu book and ubuntu unleased, both are about dapper drake(ubuntu 6.06) which is what i am running here, unleased seems more advanced though in fact it says so in the user abilities part on the book cover
oops i mean the book called ubuntu unleashed
